intro: Ocyroe spinosa, commonly known as the spiny ocyroe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Ocyroe spinosa is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
